Package com.pandora.general

Interface Sediment

All Known Implementing Classes:
SedimentSpecieBean
public interface Sediment
The Sediment interface defines methods for obtaining properties of sediment particles, including radius, density, and characteristics relevant to sediment transport.

Sediment properties are essential in studies related to fluid dynamics and sediment transport in various environments. Implementing classes should provide concrete implementations for the specified methods.

The interface includes methods to retrieve information specific to sediment behavior, such as the non-cohesive or cohesive nature, critical shield stress angle, and the Manning's "n" coefficient.

The values returned by the methods may vary based on the type of sediment, where non-cohesive sediments (e.g., sands) and cohesive sediments (e.g., silts, clays) exhibit different ranges for certain parameters.

For non-cohesive sediments (e.g., sands):

  • getAlpha() can range from about 0.01 to 10.
  • getThetaCritical() typically ranges from about 0.02 to 0.05.
  • getN() is typically around 1 to 2.

For cohesive sediments (e.g., silts, clays):

  • getAlpha() can range from about 0.001 to 1.
  • getThetaCritical() is generally lower and can range from about 0.005 to 0.02.
  • getN() can be in the range of 2 to 4.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    getAlpha()
    Gets the non-dimensional parameter "α" representing sediment characteristics.
    double
    getN()
    Gets the Manning's "n" coefficient representing the roughness of the sediment surface.
    double
    getParticleDensity()
    Gets the density of the sediment particle.
    double
    getParticleRadius()
    Gets the radius of the sediment particle.
    double
    getThetaCritical()
    Gets the critical shield stress angle "θ_c" for sediment transport.

  • Method Details

    • getParticleRadius

      double getParticleRadius()
      Gets the radius of the sediment particle.
      Returns:
      The radius of the sediment particle as a double.

    • getParticleDensity

      double getParticleDensity()
      Gets the density of the sediment particle.
      Returns:
      The density of the sediment particle as a double.

    • getAlpha

      double getAlpha()
      Gets the non-dimensional parameter "α" representing sediment characteristics. The value of "α" may vary based on the type of sediment, with different ranges for non-cohesive and cohesive sediments.
      Returns:
      The value of "α" as a double.

    • getThetaCritical

      double getThetaCritical()
      Gets the critical shield stress angle "θ_c" for sediment transport. The value of "θ_c" may vary based on the type of sediment, with different ranges for non-cohesive and cohesive sediments.
      Returns:
      The critical shield stress angle "θ_c" as a double.

    • getN

      double getN()
      Gets the Manning's "n" coefficient representing the roughness of the sediment surface. The value of "n" may vary based on the type of sediment, with different ranges for non-cohesive and cohesive sediments.
      Returns:
      The Manning's "n" coefficient as a double.
